data.title: Pierre Renoir – Wikipedia – Enzyklopädie
data.text:
Renoir (Born March 21, 1885 in Paris, † March 11, 1952 ibid) was a French actor.

Pierre Renoir was born as the eldest son of the painter Pierre-Auguste Renoir and his wife Aline Victorine Charigot. [first] His younger brother, born in 1894, was the later film director Jean Renoir. Pierre Renoir’s godfather was the painter Gustave Caillebotte friends friends with his father.

Pierre Renoir was already interested in acting in his youth. He visited the Conservatoire National Supérieur d’Art Dramatique and won the drama price in 1907 tragedy price . Although he initially showed little interest in silent film, his future wife, the actress Véra Sergine, convinced him to accept smaller film roles from 1910. In 1914, the son Claude Renoir, who later successfully worked as a cameraman, emerged from the connection with Véra Sergine.

After the death of Vera Sergine, he married actress Marie-Louise Irib, with which he founded the film production company “Les Artistes Réunis”. After the divorce, he married his third wife, Lisa, who was also an actress.

Pierre Renoir suffered serious wounds in the First World War, from which he slowly recovered. At the beginning of the 1920s, he resumed his work as an actor. From 1928 he belonged to the ensemble of his friend Louis Jouvet.

Jean Renoir convinced his brother Pierre from the possibilities of sound film in the early 1930s. In 1932 Pierre Renoir played in The night of the crossroads One of the first Maigret actors according to the literary submission of Georges Simenon. The brother Jean Renoir directed this film. The brothers later also worked on the films The Water Girl , Die Marseillaise (La Marseillaise) and Madame Bovary together.

In 1935 he played in Flag an officer so striking that he was often committed to this role in later films. One of his best -known film roles is the representation of the Jericho In the film, which was completed in 1945 under the direction of Marcel Carné Children of Olympus . When he ended his career in 1951, he was able to look back on numerous stage roles and the participation in 65 films.
